moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: with the intention of castling long
moves.9... Bd7 10. Bb3 Qa5: I have seen the arrival of the queen on the a5-square many times in Sicilians and then a contest on opposite wings has been put into order.
moves.11. O-O-O Rfc8 12. h4 Ne5 13. Kb1 Nc4 14: a case I have seen where capturing towards the center has been ignored
moves.20. Nxb5 Be6 21. Nb5d4 Bf7 22. f4 Bg7 23: Is this an oversight or Black has just seen a little farther? I mean the Knight fork on c6 as follows.
moves.27. Nc6 Bxa2+ 28. Kxa2 a3: A very strong pawn move. Now the Black queen is immune to capture as 29.Nxd8 axb2+ 30.Kb1 Ra1#.
